Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of his would-be lover and mentally unstable classmate Laura (Rachel McAdams). This is essentially a story about young love so the focus is definitely on the turmoil and tribulations of complex and often ambiguous relationships. This is a dramatic, troubling, and ultimately a poetic film.
It is a labor of love. Four

I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of the competition between the kids, and the family tradition and background they shared; then in the second hour, it gives off a sense of separation between the characters.
